page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content: The church is called St. Botolph's church. St. Botolph was born in the 7th century and 64 churches are dedicated to him in England. The church lies near to most of the houses, and is used for village meetings and as a polling station because there is no hall. It is made of sandstone and has a square tower. Over the doorway is a sundial and in the tower are five bells.The gate, which is falling apart, was erected to commemorate Queen Elizabeth 2 coronation, and a new one to replace it will remember those who died in the war. Records at the church go back to 1574. There have been congregations of over 30 in the past but there are only about 10 now. The vicar is also in charge of Wolvey church.
